movies.title: I oraia ton Athinon
movies.plot: A streetwise guy, according to a will, has to marry an extremely ugly old lady to get the money of the inheritance.So he tries to trick a poor devil into getting married with her.
movies.simplePlot: A streetwise guy, according to a will, has to marry an extremely ugly old lady to get the money of the inheritance.So he tries to trick a poor devil into getting married with her.

biography.bio: Mimis Fotopoulos was born on April 20, 1913 in Zatouna Gortynias, Greece. He was an actor and writer, known for The Hurdy-Gurdy (1955), The Counterfeit Coin (1955) and Laterna, ftoheia kai garyfallo (1958). He died on October 29, 1986 in Athens, Greece.
biography.name: Mimis Fotopoulos

biography.bio: Vasiliadou was born in 1897, in Athens, Greece. Her real name was Georgia Athanasiou. She was obliged to leave school early and work as a shop girl, in order to help her family. She made her stage debut in 1918, but began her studies at the Gennadeios Rhonetic School in 1923 and appeared in some operas. She then worked with the major theater companies of the period (Kyveli , Marika Kotopouli, Dimitris Myrat), playing a wide range of parts. In the mid-1930s she decided to retire, but Alekos Sakellarios offered her a small part in the 1939 musical comedy "Koritsia tis pantreias"; that was the genesis of a second career for the middle-aged actress, who went on to star in many comedies and revues and created personal stage groups until the late 1960s. She also made a tentative movie debut in 1930, but became one of the all-time greats of the Greek cinema during the 1950s, when she starred in extremely popular comedies like I oraia ton Athinon (1954), in which Nikos Tsiforos played with her unconventional external appearance, and _Theia apo to Sikago, I (1957)_, in which director-writer Alekos Sakellarios cast her as a wealthy Greek-American who returns to Greece after thirty years and brings a fresh lifestyle to the family of her conservative brother. She died in 1980, but is always fondly remembered by Greek audiences.
biography.name: Georgia Vasileiadou

biography.bio: Nikos Stavridis was born in 1910 in Samos, Greece. He was an actor, known for The Yellow Gloves (1960), Triti kai 13 (1963) and Eftyhos... trellathika! (1961). He died on December 12, 1987 in Samos.
biography.name: Nikos Stavridis

biography.bio: Sperantza Vrana was born on February 6, 1926 in Messolongi, Greece as Elpis Homatianou. She was an actress, known for The Counterfeit Coin (1955), Lust and Passion (1960) and Melpo (1958). She died on September 29, 2009 in Athens, Greece.
biography.name: Sperantza Vrana

biography.bio: Gelly Mavropoulou was born in 1932, in Thessaloniki, Greece, but raised in Athens. She belongs to a large theatrical family and studied at the prestigious Theatro Technis (Art Theater)under the direction of Carolos Koun. She made her stage debut in a 1955 Athens production of George Axelrod's "The Seven-Year Itch" starring Melina Mercouri, and quickly became a top actress, playing important leading roles in Shakespeare's "Othello" (as Dysdemona) and "The Taming of the Shrew" (as Bianca), Aeschylus' "Oresteia" (as Goddess Athena), Molière's "Le Tartuffe" (as Dorine) and many other modern and classical plays; she often created personal groups and finished her career in the early 1990s as a member of the Greek National Theater. She also acted regularly in films and became one of the major Greek female movie stars of the 1950's and 1960's, satisfactory in both comedies and melodramas. But she enjoyed the biggest success of her career in 1971, when she starred in the legendary TV series Agnostos polemos (1971).
biography.name: Gely Mavropoulou

biography.bio: Vasilis Avlonitis was born in 1904 in Athens, Greece. He was an actor, known for O Klearhos, i Marina kai o kontos (1961), The Hurdy-Gurdy (1955) and Oi gabroi tis Eftyhias (1962). He died on March 10, 1970 in Athens.
biography.name: Vasilis Avlonitis

biography.bio: Stavros Xenidis was born in 1924 in Constantinople [now Istanbul], Turkey. He was an actor, known for Loaf and Camouflage (1984), Honeymoon (1979) and A Wedding on the Fringe (1989). He was married to Margarita Labrinou. He died on November 2, 2008 in Athens, Greece.
biography.name: Stavros Xenidis

biography.bio: Velissarios Kondogiannis is an actor, known for I oraia ton Athinon (1954), The Wise Guy (1962) and Murder Backstage (1960).
biography.name: Velissarios Kondogiannis

biography.bio: Hrysanthi Liappi is an actress, known for I oraia ton Athinon (1954) and Good Times, Money and Love (1955).
biography.name: Hrysanthi Liappi

biography.bio: Marika Bonasera is an actress, known for I oraia ton Athinon (1954).
biography.name: Marika Bonasera

biography.bio: Angela Sevili is an actress, known for I oraia ton Athinon (1954).
biography.name: Angela Sevili

biography.bio: Golfo Bini was born in 1904. She was an actress, known for The Wise Guy (1962), I oraia ton Athinon (1954) and Epiheirisis: Orma hondre (1966). She was married to Nikitas Platis. She died in 1989.
biography.name: Golfo Bini

biography.bio: Rallis Angelidis is an actor, known for O kapetan Sorokadas (1953), The Hurdy-Gurdy (1955) and Hilies para mia nyhtes (1960).
biography.name: Rallis Angelidis

biography.bio: Mistos Handas is an actor, known for Piso kai sas fagame (1972), I oraia ton Athinon (1954) and Experts on the Football Field (1956).
biography.name: Mistos Handas

biography.bio: Trio Kitara is an actor, known for I oraia ton Athinon (1954).
biography.name: Trio Kitara
